page.title: 03TRADE- market
page.content: Toilets; better lighting in winter; more stalls; fewer clothing stalls; extend to high street; close Newgates to traffic. About 50% of shoppers interviewed lived in Stamford. The rest lived in surrounding villages such as Uffington, Ryhall and Wittering. About 60% came by car, 24% on foot, 10% by public transport and 6% by cycls. The purchase most frequently made at the market is fresh produce, the main reasons for this being low prices and freshness, 76% of those interviewed rated Stamford Market excellent of good, 14% average and 10% poor. Shoppers in general wanted better and cheaper parking facilities, a twice weekly market, and one original request was for busking. By Warren Rogers
